page.title: 03Stock Breeding-Waverley Farm
page.content: This farm specialises in breeding dairy cattle. The cows generally produce 1 calf p.a. There is a 50% rate of male and female. 65 heffers are kept, 4 young bulls, 2 stock bulls for serving and 155 breeding cows. { Artificial Insemination}is the main method of reproduction used. Bulls are needed to serve cows which cannot accept this form. The success rate for A.I. is 62%. The semen used is kept in tanks of liquid nitrogen and has lasted 38 yrs. and has still been successful. Embryos are stored along with these and have lasted successfully for 28 yrs. An average number of 150 young calves are produced p.a. The remainder of the cattle produced are sold at Salisbury market for beef, each fetching up to Â£132, depending on the quality of the calf.
